snippet: The arrest of Altaf Hussain on suspicion of money laundering caused panic in his stronghold of Karachi, Pakistan, where businesses closed and residents rushed home fearing political violence.
abstract: Arrest of Pakistani political boss Altaf Hussain in Great Britain on money laundering charges causes residents of Karachi, Pakistan, to gird themselves for trouble, with business shuttering, trains stopping and workers racing home; Hussain has for past two decades controlled the city from his exile in England, and city's reaction to his arrest is a measure of his power.

byline.contributor: Saba Imtiaz contributed reporting from Karachi, Pakistan, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The arrest of Altaf Hussain on suspicion of money laundering caused panic in his stronghold of Karachi, Pakistan, where businesses closed and residents rushed home fearing political violence.

headline.seo: Inquiry Snares Altaf Hussein, Exiled M.Q.M. Chief
headline.main: Pakistan Shaken by Faraway Arrest of Political Boss
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Shaken by Faraway Arrest of Political Boss
